p.seg: Footnotes to this letter need more work, both with respect to the specimen number problem, and also citations to the timber collection. For the latter there are a number of references in other footnotes. AML 6-8-2021

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: -0.8862in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0.0417in; text-align: end; text-indent: 0.8862in; color: #c00000;

div.p: GRG 19/391, State Records of South Australia, Adelaide.

p.seg: Die Acacia in Ihrer Sammlung N. 310, lieber Herr Holtze u. in Ihrer Timber-collect. N. 2 ist A. auriculiformis. Samen davon waren erwünscht. Ich glaube es ist ein ziemlich grosser Baum. Das Holz wird in Nord Queensland gelobt.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
The Acacia, in your collection No. 310,
See M to M. Holtze, 1883 (in this edition as 83-00-00m). dear Mr Holtze, and in your timber collection No. 2,
See M to M. Holtze, list 1886. See also M to M. Holtze, 1890 and M. Holtze to M, 24 April 1890. is A. auriculiformis. Seeds thereof were desired. I believe it is a rather tall tree. Its wood is being praised in North Queensland.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-size: 10pt;
font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-size: 10pt;
